name: Age Calculator Vanilla JS
desc: I've developed an Age Calculator for the Frontend Mentor challenge. It's a user-friendly tool crafted with vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Users simply enter their date of birth, and the calculator promptly displays their age. I've integrated a jQuery date picker to streamline the experience further. The entire project is hosted on Netlify, ensuring it's accessible to users everywhere.

name: To Do List Vanilla JS
desc: I also feature a To-Do List App designed for the Frontend Mentor challenge. This simple yet effective application allows users to add items to their to-do list, helping them manage tasks more efficiently. It's built with vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focusing on a clean and straightforward user interface.

name: To Do List React
desc: This is my To-Do List app, initially built with Vanilla JS and later converted to React as I began learning the framework. Hosted on Netlify and open-source, the project is available for collaboration and exploration on GitHub.

name: Advice Generator
desc: This project is an Advice Generator that marks a significant step in my React journey, focusing on API integration. It showcases my growing skills in enhancing React applications with APIs to improve user experiences.

name: Tic Tac Toe Vanilla JS
desc: This project is a Tic Tac Toe game built in Vanilla JavaScript, aimed at mastering dynamic function creation. Through this game, I enhanced my skills in implementing interactive and logic-driven functionalities, marking a key milestone in my web development journey.

name: myFriends App
desc: The myFriends app is a key project in my backend development journey, built using Laravel, Tailwind CSS, and MySQL. This project allowed me to deeply explore Laravel's features, mastering user authentication and the ability to maintain a logbook of friends. It provided comprehensive hands-on experience in using Laravel to develop functional and user-friendly web applications.

name: Larapen
desc: Larapen is a collaborative project by two developers, inspired by CodePen, aimed at exploring the Laravel backend framework. The project serves as a clone of CodePen, providing a platform for developers to share and discover front-end code snippets. Through this project, the developers honed their skills in teamwork and mastered the intricacies of version control using Git. This repository showcases their journey in building a robust web application using Laravel and emphasizes the importance of collaborative software development practices.
